1:
I love you, Yahweh, my strength.

\q
2:
Yahweh is my rock, my fortress, the one who brings me to safety; he is my God, my rock; I take refuge in him.\q He is my shield, the horn of my salvation, and my stronghold.
\q
3:
I will call on Yahweh who is worthy to be praised, and I will be saved from my enemies.

\q
4: The cords of death surrounded me, and the rushing waters of worthlessness overwhelmed me.\q
5:
The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of death trapped me.

\q
6:
In my distress I called to Yahweh; I called for help to my God. He heard my voice from his temple;\q my call for help went into his presence; it went into his ears.


\q
7:
Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations of the mountains also trembled\q and were shaken because God was angry.
\q
8:
Smoke went up from out of his nostrils, and blazing fire came out of his mouth. Coals were ignited by it.

\q
9: He opened the heavens and came down, and thick darkness was under his feet.\q
10:
He rode on a cherub and flew; he glided on the wings of the wind.

\q
11: He made darkness a tent around him, heavy rainclouds in the skies.\q
12:
Hailstones and coals of fire fell from the lightning before him.

\q
13:
Yahweh thundered in the heavens! The voice of the Most High shouted.\f + \ft Some modern versions add after shouted, \fqa hailstones and coals of fire \fqa* this expression may be an accidental repetition from the previous verse. \f*
\q
14:
He shot his arrows and scattered his enemies; many lightning bolts dispersed them. 

\q
15:
Then the water channels appeared; \q1 the foundations of the world were laid bare 
\q1 at your rebuke, Yahweh,
\q at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.


\q
16: He reached down from above; he took hold of me! He pulled me out of the surging water.\q
17:
He rescued me from my strong enemy, from those who hated me, for they were too strong for me.

\q
18: They came against me on the day of my distress but Yahweh was my support!\q
19:
He set me free in a wide open place; he saved me because he was pleased with me.

\q
20: Yahweh has rewarded me because of my righteousness; he has restored me because my hands were clean.\q
21:
For I have kept the ways of Yahweh and have not wickedly turned away from my God.

\q
22: For all his righteous decrees have been before me; as for his statutes, I have not turned away from them.\q
23: I have also been innocent before him, and I have kept myself from sin.\q
24:
Therefore Yahweh has restored me because of my righteousness, because my hands were clean before his eyes.

\q
25:
To anyone who is faithful, you show yourself to be faithful;\q2 to a man who is blameless, you show yourself to be blameless.
\q
26:
To anyone who is pure, you show yourself pure; but you are clever toward anyone who is twisted.

\q
27: For you save afflicted people, but you bring down those with proud, uplifted eyes!\q
28: For you give light to my lamp; Yahweh my God lights up my darkness.\q
29:
For by you I can run over a barricade; by my God I can leap over a wall.

\q
30:
As for Godâ€”his way is perfect! The word of Yahweh is pure!\q He is a shield to everyone who takes refuge in him.
\q
31: For who is God except Yahweh? Who is a rock except our God?\q
32:
It is God who puts strength on me like a belt, who places the blameless person on his path.

\q
33: He makes my feet swift like a deer and places me on the heights!\q
34:
He trains my hands for war and my arms to bend a bow of bronze.

\q
35: You have given me the shield of your salvation. Your right hand has supported me, and your favor has made me great.\q
36:
You have made a wide place for my feet beneath me so that my feet have not slipped.

\q
37: I pursued my enemies and caught them; I did not turn back until they were destroyed.\q
38: I smashed them so that they were unable to rise; they have fallen under my feet.\q
39:
For you put strength on me like a belt for battle; you put under me those who rise up against me.

\q
40: You gave me the back of my enemies' necks; I annihilated those who hated me.\q
41: They called for help, but no one saved them; they called out to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.\q
42:
I beat them into fine pieces like dust before the wind; I threw them out like mud in the streets.

\q
43: You rescued me from the disputes of people. You have made me the head over nations. People that I have not known serve me.\q
44: As soon as they heard of me, they obeyed me; foreigners were forced to bow to me.\q
45:
The foreigners came trembling out of their strongholds.

\q
46: Yahweh lives; may my rock be praised. May the God of my salvation be exalted.\q
47:
He is the God who executes vengeance for me, who subdues the nations under me.

\q
48: I am set free from my enemies! Indeed, you lifted me above the ones who rose against me! You rescued me from violent men.\q
49:
Therefore I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations; I will sing praises to your name!

\q
50: God gives great victory to his king, and he shows his covenant loyalty to his anointed one, to David and to his descendants forever.
